title: Goldman Sachs maintains Buy on Flextronics post-acquisition By Investing.com
text:
Thursday, Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS ) reaffirmed its Buy rating on Flextronics (NASDAQ: FLEX) with a steady price target of $39.00. The endorsement follows Flextronics' announcement of its intent to purchase Crown Technical Systems for $325 million in cash. This strategic move is expected to bolster Flextronics' position in the power distribution and protection systems industry.
On Thursday, Flextronics disclosed the acquisition of Crown Technical Systems, a provider of modular solutions and products for medium voltage switchgear, control, and relay. The deal, valued at $325 million, will be conducted entirely in cash. Crown Technical Systems is anticipated to contribute approximately $120 million in revenue with a high-teens EBITDA margin by the end of its fiscal year on March 31, 2025.
The acquisition is seen as a strategic fit within Flextronics' Platforms & Power thesis, which posits that the rising demand for AI, intelligent machines, and electrification will present new opportunities in industrial technology sectors, particularly for datacenter and utilities/grid applications. Goldman Sachs views Flextronics as well positioned to benefit from these trends.
Flextronics had previously indicated that its existing portfolio of products and services could address over 80% of the datacenter market opportunity. The addition of Crown Technical Systems is expected to enhance Flextronics' capabilities and market reach in this area.
The transaction is part of Flextronics' broader strategy to expand its influence in the industrial technology market, leveraging the growth in demand for advanced power solutions. With the acquisition of Crown Technical Systems, Flextronics aims to strengthen its offerings and capitalize on the anticipated growth in this sector.
In other recent news, Flex (NASDAQ: FLEX ) Ltd. has announced a series of strategic moves and financial results. The company reported strong Q1 earnings for fiscal year 2025, with net sales of $6.3 billion and a GAAP operating income of $233 million. Flex also plans to acquire Crown Technical Systems for $325 million, which is expected to enhance its capabilities in power distribution and protection systems.
The company has also partnered with JetCool to develop server solutions for AI servers and high-density computing. Further, Flex has approved significant supplemental equity awards for two of its top executives, aiming at long-term retention and incentivizing superior shareholder returns. In addition, Flex's shareholders approved a share repurchase plan with a maximum expenditure of $1.7 billion.
Several analysts have provided their takes on Flex's recent developments. Goldman Sachs maintained their Buy rating on the company, while Craig-Hallum upgraded Flex's stock from Hold to Buy. However, JPMorgan (NYSE: JPM ) revised its outlook, reducing the price target to $39.00 due to challenges in the automotive and industrial sectors. These are recent developments that highlight the strategic moves and financial performance of Flex Ltd.
